mild_hybrid.title: 48V Mild Hybrid
mild_hybrid.comment: The 48 Volt Mild Hybrid system boosts and supports the engine during acceleration, while also reducing emissions and saving fuel.

mild_hybrid.title: Travel through cities with ease
mild_hybrid.comment: The Mild Hybrid system lends itself to city traffic, as it enables the combustion engine to restart faster and more smoothly.

mild_hybrid.title: The advantages of a generator
mild_hybrid.comment: The Mild Hybrid Starter Generator supports the motor and stores excess electricity in the additional battery located under the luggage compartment. Under acceleration, it supports the engine with 4 to 12kW of power.

mild_hybrid.title: Comfort start
mild_hybrid.comment: The Mild Hybrid Starter Generator enables faster and smoother engine starts with a powerful take-off boost from the 48V battery.

mild_hybrid.title: Constant driving
mild_hybrid.comment: At constant speeds, the Mild Hybrid Starter Generator is idle or acts as a generator to recharge the 48V battery.

mild_hybrid.title: Recuperation
mild_hybrid.comment: The Mild Hybrid Starter Generator converts kinetic braking energy into electricity. Recuperating 10-12kW back into the 48V battery.

hydrogen.title: Designed for beauty - but created for efficiency
hydrogen.comment: The NEXO is a truly one-of-a-kind hydrogen fuel cell SUV that combines cutting-edge technology and futuristic design with fantastic driving range.

hydrogen.title: 666km* driving range
hydrogen.comment: With a driving range of 666km* and the best fuel cell efficiency in the world, NEXO is in a class of its own.

hydrogen.title: The hydrogen powertrain
hydrogen.comment: Fuel cell technology uses hydrogen to produce electricity. This energy is either transformed by an electric motor into motion or stored by the battery. The battery acts as an energy reserve and also stores recuperative energy.

hydrogen.title: How fuel cell works
hydrogen.comment: NEXO’s fuel cell stack combines hydrogen and oxygen to derive its energy. As protons bind with oxygen ions, it forms the technology’s sole emission: water.

hydrogen.title: Step 1
hydrogen.comment: Oxygen from the surrounding air and hydrogen stored in the tanks flow into separate parts of the fuel cell stack.

hydrogen.title: Step 2
hydrogen.comment: The reactions that take place in the fuel cell stack produce electricity and water.

hydrogen.title: Step 3
hydrogen.comment: The generated electricity is supplied to the motor and battery to drive the vehicle.

hydrogen.title: Step 4
hydrogen.comment: Water is the only tailpipe emission.

hydrogen.title: Hydrogen
hydrogen.comment: Hydrogen is a versatile, clean, and safe energy carrier. Generating zero emissions at point of use, it can be produced from renewable electricity and from carbon-abated fossil fuels, thereby achieving completely zero-emission pathways.

full_electric.title: Up to twice the efficiency
full_electric.comment: The ration between the power generated by the motor and the energy inputted is better in an electric motor compared to internal-combustion.

full_electric.title: Clever charging solutions
full_electric.comment: Providing full coverage for e-mobility, Hyundai and IONITY* have joined forces to supply a wide network of charging solutions with clean energy.

full_electric.title: Constant driving
full_electric.comment: Battery powers the electric motor, which powers the wheels.

full_electric.title: Extending range
full_electric.comment: Decelerate and generate power. The electric motor recuperates energy while slowing down.

full_electric.title: External charging
full_electric.comment: Plug in and recharge. At home, at work or at public charging spots.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Electric when you want it. Petrol when you need it
plug_in_hybrid.comment: A Plug-in Hybrid offers the best of both worlds: an all-electric driving range with the added flexibility of a petrol engine.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Plugged into efficiency
plug_in_hybrid.comment: In hybrid mode, the battery-powered electric motor works in tandem with the petrol engine to deliver amazing fuel economy and lower emissions.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Larger battery, greater range
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Activate full-electric driving by pushing the EV mode button. Once the battery is depleted or EV mode deactivated by pushing the button again, the car operates as a hybrid.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Power flow and ECO-DAS
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Excellent fuel efficiency and low CO₂ emissions are supported by the ECO Driving Assistant System (ECO-DAS).*

plug_in_hybrid.title: Start
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Active EV mode allows for low speed travel and acceleration, powered by the electric motor.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Acceleration
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Electric motor and petrol engine operate together to maximise acceleration and minimise fuel consumption.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Driving
plug_in_hybrid.comment: At constant speeds, power is provided by either the petrol engine or the electric motor, whichever is the most energy-efficient in that situation.

plug_in_hybrid.title: Deceleration & Recuperation
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Regenerative braking charges the battery when driving downhill, braking or decelerating.

plug_in_hybrid.title: External charging
plug_in_hybrid.comment: Plug-in Hybrid’s battery can be charged by external power sources. Enjoy the fully-electric driving as long as the battery is charged.

hybrid.title: Hybrid
hybrid.comment: Low CO₂ emissions and fuel consumption

hybrid.title: A full-parallel hybrid drive system
hybrid.comment: A Hybrid Powertrain features a full-parallel hybrid drive system. A highly efficient petrol engine and electric motor work together to deliver excellent fuel economy and lower emissions.

hybrid.title: A new generation of mobility
hybrid.comment: Nobody said that lowering emissions had to be boring. Thanks to innovative hybrid tech, a Hybrid combines head-turning looks with exceptional efficiency.

hybrid.title: Seamless switching between engines
hybrid.comment: Depending on the driving situation, a Hybrid Powertrain switches seamlessly between petrol engine and electric motor, sometimes utilizing both together. The regenerative braking system charges the battery by using the electric motor to slow down the car.

hybrid.title: Start
hybrid.comment: When starting or driving at low speed, the electricity stored in the battery powers the electric motor.

hybrid.title: Acceleration
hybrid.comment: Electric motor and petrol operate together to maximise acceleration and minimise fuel consumption.

hybrid.title: Driving
hybrid.comment: At constant speeds, power is provided by either the petrol engine or the electric motor, whichever is the most energy-efficient in that situation.

hybrid.title: Deceleration & Recuperation
hybrid.comment: The regenerative braking system charges the battery by using the electric motor to slow the car down. When ecelerating or driving downhill, the energy generated is stored in the battery.
